comment: Despite all the same negative reviews (one person but probably switched up the words a bit) she was a decent professor. She did stray from the normal “Love & Sex” category and did talk more about race. Assignments were SUPER easy just required a bit of reading. She gave so much extra credit that I did it all and my 82 went to a 91.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework

comment: Worst professor I've had so far. Everything was graded on her opinion and she gave terrible/no feedback for improvement either. Pretty sure she has some superiority complex over students which causes her to poorly grade responses she doesn't agree with. She also made a lot of the class about race. I would avoid her class and take with someone else.

This professor doesn't do feedback when grading work, so I do not understand what I could fix to improve for the next assignment. She grades based off of opinion and did not stay consist with in person class for the day it was available, she switched to virtual suddenly, but still could not even be consistent with that when canceling classes.

Not a good professor!! Grades everything based on her own opinion and gives no real explanation for why she takes points besides “I didn't like that answer.” Makes A LOT of the class about race/being oppressed when the class is called “Gender and Women's Studies.” Was excited to see different perspectives on these topics but she made it miserable.
She was a good prof, it was just A LOT of reading. It was hybrid and was mainly based off reading assignments.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Words can't describe the miserable time I had in this class. She switched us to zoom mid semester just because and cancels class at least twice a month. She grades based on opinions rather than facts. Most of the content discussed in class does not appear on exams and most exam content is based on books we didn't read.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Online Savvy

comment: Awful professor. Told class she bases grading on her own opinions rather than actual correctness. She makes so much of the course on race rather than what it's actually meant to be on. Gives poor instructions and then harshly grades based on her feelings as previously stated. The class isn't really hard, but you better hope she agrees with you…

Dr. Canty structured the class pretty well, but with the weekly reading logs, she was hard to impress. I felt like she docked points off my reading logs at random. Also for the final blog, start EARLY. We had 3 blog checkpoints which included 2 posts, but at the end of the semester with only weeks left she said we needed 6 posts for the final blog.

I feel as though this class should be an easy A, but it isn't. Her grading is too harsh especially if most of the stuff that we did is our opinions; therefore, I feel that she shouldn't be too cruel when grading. She definitely does not respond to emails. Very feminist and doesn't really try to work with students.

Dr. Canty was real cool. She cared about her course and came with enthusiasm each class. Class discussions were always interesting, and the readings were too. Attendance isn't mandatory, but lectures ppts aren't available online, so it helps to show up. Overall, the class was pretty easy and interesting. Would take her again.

Really great professor! Cares about her topic, and this class is great for engaging with your peers and the professor. The class discussions are always interesting, and she assigns reading that she knows we will find interesting and thought provoking. Take this class to lighten up the load of your semester.

I was excited about this class. The topics are relatable to college students & she is very open. What made this class non enjoyable over time is that she doesn't respond to emails, but will post on Facebook often. She is a harsh grader as well and her views are feminist. This class should be an easy A if you do your work, but she doesn't give those

Professor Canty is really knowledgeable on the subject and has interesting lectures, however, she's a harsh grader considering the class is a gen ed course. She stated multiple times that she does not give 100s and that her 94s are basically 100 level work. However, It's still an easy A if you do the work and she doesn't require attendance.

Probably the most fun class I've ever taken! The lectures are very interesting and really makes you think about things in a new light. There's only one quiz, no midterm, and the final is a group project. One of the only classes that I actually got excited about going to and encouraged others to take.

Fun class!! Highly recommend as an elective! Class discussions are fun and encouraged. Prof does a good job of making you feel comfortable voicing your opinions. Be open minded. Pretty easy A, however, save your notes because Prof decided to take them all off line with no warning before the final. Other than that, definitely worth taking
Makes the class center around race instead of love and sex. Also gives an incredibly hard midterm and takes down all the online notes right before midterm.
